subject: Nutrition
title: Vitamin K and Blood Clotting
description: One-minute skill: Vitamin K and Blood Clotting.

hook.text: Cut yourself and blood clots in minutes. Without vitamin K, that wound would never stop bleeding.

buildup.text: Vitamin K activates proteins that form blood clotsâ€”the name comes from 'koagulation' in German.

discovery.text: Two main forms exist: K1 from leafy greens and K2 from fermented foods and animal products.

twist.text: Newborns are born with almost no vitamin K, which is why hospitals give them an injection at birth.

climax.text: Vitamin K2 also directs calcium into bones and away from arteries, potentially preventing heart disease.

punchline.text: The clotting vitamin also protects your arteries.

quiz.question: Why do newborns receive a vitamin K injection?
options: Because they're born with almost none
